byline.original: By GEETA ANAND and NIDA NAJAR

abstract: Deadly demonstrations by Jat caste group, in which 19 people are killed and New Delhi water supply is disrupted, force lawmakers in India's Haryana State to propose bill granting group 'backward' status; group is among several prosperous castes paradoxically seeking socioeconomic downgrading, in order to be eligible for university seats and government job quotas.
lead_paragraph: The state government promised to introduce a bill to grant coveted “backward” status to the Jats, whose protests had choked New Delhi’s water supply.

headline.main: Haryana State in India Proposes New Caste Status in Bid to Quell Protests
headline.print_headline: Indian State Moves to Placate Group Demanding ‘Backward’ Status

snippet: The state government promised to introduce a bill to grant coveted “backward” status to the Jats, whose protests had choked New Delhi’s water supply.
